Reviews.Title: “One happy family”
Reviews.Author: Louise G
Reviews.Content: We really loved this wonderful little character hotel. It was everything we could have asked for. The room was spotless, a decent size, and very comfortable. The central location is very handy, though you are not paying top price for a room, and it is far enough back from the main roads, as to have little traffic noise. Above all, the staff were absolutely wonderful, they couldn't have been more helpful, accommodating and friendly. We would definitely be staying again, if we were traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, convenient location, comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: Balmyknot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March with my 7 year old daughter and found Le Relais du Louvre to be a friendly, well positioned and quiet hotel. For its class, it offers everything you need. Yes, it is no frills and you could stay somewhere much more luxurious, but I found that many of these luxury hotels were on bust streets whereas Le Relais du Louvre really is tucked away from the bustle - yet only a couple of minutes' walk from it! The Louvre museum is a stone's throw and opens late on Wednesday (and one other day - I can't remember) - the pyramid is beautiful lit up against the night sky. The Jardin des Tuileries is also close by, and children can sail little boats by a fountain (2 Euros for half an hour). A walk to Musee D'Orsay is about half an hour through the Jardin des Tuileries and across the Seine, and then a taxi to the Eiffel Tower from Musee D'Orsay costs about 7 Euros and is worth doing to save your legs. My daughter loved it all. The hotel is small but tidy and we had a lovely bathroom in room 42. Reception is manned all night so you don't have to worry about a key, and the owners/managers were very happy to help my daughter with her French. Best of all, when I managed to leave all my luggage (passports, boarding passes, laptop...) in the back of a taxi on our last day (having checked out of the hotel), it was the hotel that the taxi driver phoned when he eventually found it all in the boot of his car. The hotel immediately phoned me and liaised between a French-speaking person I accosted in Place de la Madeleine (where I happened to be) and the taxi driver (who spoke no English) to help my luggage find its way back to me. They were brilliant. The Relais de Louvre is extremely well positioned to explore the Louvre, Les Jardin Tuileries, areas of the Left Bank, Place de la Madeleine and even as far out as Musee D'Orsay and the opera house on foot. It is clean and comfortable, not frilly, and the beds are comfortable. It is also quiet, and I found that priceless, as I did the staff's attitude to my daughter; they were kind and interested and made her feel special. Thank you, Relais de Louvre!

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely little hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: peacefultravelfortwo
Reviews.Content: A completely perfect experience! I will definitely stay here again. The view from the room of the ancient church, Saint Germain l'Auxerrois, was charming. The quiet little street, just near the Seine, the Louvre, and within walking distance to many points of interest, good restaurants, markets, shopping, etc. it's a small perfectly run boutique hotel wirh class. We had two rooms and stayed in the apartment at the end of our stay which was also nice. This was perfect charm for a week in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Calm, elegant hotel very close to Pont Neuf station”
Reviews.Author: JLF74
Reviews.Content: A small, clean, elegant hotel in a lovely old building just 2 mins walk from Pont Neuf station and a short walk to the Louvre itself. The staff were extremely kind and helpful, room service food quality was excellent and the comfort factor was high: no identikit hotel-feel here. Furnishings were classy and made of lovely, elegant materials. A very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: FancyDay
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in approximately 20 hotels/apartments in Paris and Relais du Louvre rates right at the top. I prefer the Left Bank, but booked here for close proximity to the Louvre for my elderly father, and would definitely stay again. The location is fantastic. Yes, the rooms and bathrooms are "Parisian small" but they are quite nice. Everything you read here about Sophie, Frederique and the staff is true - they are warm, helpful and charming. When my father became ill, Sophie offered to move him to a larger room. The hotel was undergoing some plumbing works, which didn't bother us in the least. But Sophie kindly left a nice note and a bottle of Laurent-Perrier in our room to compensate for the noise. We chose not to take breakfast and got coffee and croissants around the corner at the Cafe du Pont Neuf, This is a surprisingly nice cafe with good menu, considering the touristic location. Don't hesitate to book at this fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Paula B
Reviews.Content: If you want the perfect Paris experience at the best location and wonderful personnel, this hotel should be a 5 star! The staff is welcoming, the location is perfect, and the accommodations are on point! We are a family of three...with a teenager, and we could not have been more pleased. Nice sized room for Paris. It felt like Paris and we enjoyed it much better than staying in a boutique hotel. More than anything it was definitely Sofie, Fredrique, and the rest of the wonderful staff that put it over the top for our family!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, reasonable hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: xj0r
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Relais du Louvre just one night for work in December 2011. It is in a prime location near the Louvre, not too far from the Pont Neuf metro station. But being off the main street means it is quiet at night and you'll still get a good sleep. I took a walk around the area that night: to the Louvre, across the Pont des Arts, to the Notre Dame, etc. It is a very lovely location in Paris, much better than when I've stayed near Gare du Nord thinking I should stay close to the station for my Eurostar trip. It is worth the small metro trip towards the Seine and stay near there instead, much nicer! The staff were lovely, certainly nothing to complain about there. They were helpful when I asked them questions, but in general I didn't need much since it was just a quick trip for work not several days holiday where I'd want to see the sights. They let me leave my bags on the second day, and use their bathroom to change when I got back, so I thought they were very accommodating -though other people may expect this from any hotel. The room was small but most hotels in Paris are, especially in this price range. I got a good enough sleep so I was happy with it. Little disappointed with the breakfast, especially with how much it cost - I would have expected more for that price. In hindsight I should have just bought a couple of croissants and a juice from a nearby cafe, it would have cost me less and been the same breakfast and I've enjoyed it more than sitting in my room at the small desk. Never mind, we live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location (Louvre & Pont Neuf) & Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: ge0rgeous
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel has everything a boutique hotel has to offer!! A little pricey but definitely worth it. They have about 20 rooms in total, so book in advance! Rooms are tiny, but good enough-- they are very zealous about their daily cleaning of the rooms. Unaffected, personable service -- we both spoke no french, and went to Paris mostly unresearched but they recommended nice restaurants and always went the extra mile to suggest + make reservations for us. Buy the Fast Track Ticket from them for The Louvre to avoid the crazy crowds! The Louvre has recently been voted the world's most popular museum and has 40% more visitors than the British Museum - so, seriously - just grab the ticket from the hotel. My partner and I gleefully found ourselves sauntering past the massive lines, right into the museum.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique hotel in view of the Louvre and almost adjacent to the Seine and Pont Neuf”
Reviews.Author: ChunkyAl
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay we had at this little hotel. The Walls of our room were covered in fabric as was everything else. Very quiet. The beds were so soft. The staff were wonderful so friendly, welcoming and helpful. Not cheap but worth it. Oh and buy the fast track ticket for the Louvre from them it's well worth it even just for the looks on the faces of the people that have been wiring to get in for hours!

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel with a good location.”
Reviews.Author: FancyFriday
Reviews.Content: We spent only three nights in Paris and chose this hotel for its location within the city. The prices were good for being so close to Notre Dame and it is literally across the street from the Louvre. Other museums and landmarks (Eiffel Tower, Eye of Paris, etc.) did not require a metro ride, but the walks to and from the hotel were usually thirty minutes to an hour. The staff was helpful and courteous, though there could be a better system for getting into the hotel late at night since you have to ring a bell and wait for an attendant to open the door and they are not always at the front desk. I highly suggest buying tickets to museums/etc. through the hotel since they are priced only a few euro higher, but you skip the HUGE lines that wait to get in. Obviously, you get what you pay for with rooms, they can be very small and the extra bed in our room kept breaking (literally, the boards holding up the mattress would fall out). Overall, it is a very small, quaint (but nice) hotel that gives you access to many great sites in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: Honeychild_73
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in one or two chain hotels in Paris and everything seemed to be a chore for the staff. Having researched hotels in central Paris, I thought that I would give the Le Relais du Louvre a try. From the moment that I walked in, I got such a warm and friendly greeting from the staff in reception. Everything was explained to me in great detail and I was given my keys to my room and safe. The room itself was on the smaller side (I was a single traveller therefore it really did not matter). The room was clean and tidy, as was the bathroom and there was more than enough wardrobe space. After I had unpacked I asked reception if they could call for a taxi to my concert venue (nothing was any trouble for them). Upon my late return, the friendly night porter let me in and as I don't sleep well in hotels I was ready for a sleepless night. Wrong. The double bed was so comfortable that I drifted off in minutes (the hotel is located in a very quiet street too which helps). I ordered the optional breakfast in the morning and it was more than plentiful and the croissants and pains chocolat were incredibly fresh. The location of the hotel is perfect, turn left out of the hotel and the Louvre is in front of you, a minutes walk takes you to the River Seine. I opted to do the bus tour of Paris but wasn't sure which bus company to take and again the staff filled me in with all the details (the sightseeing stop is also located about 2 minutes from the hotel). I will most definitely return to this hotel next year. A five star service from the staff! Anna

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Geoff_lambert
Reviews.Content: A small hotel with the best location in Paris. My wife & I stayed 5 nights in mid October. Arriving from Australia on our first visit to France, the transfer at 6am was well organised & smooth, our luggage easily stored, and staff friendly - speaking both french & english. The location of this little hotel is perfect, directly behind the Louvre, close to Metro stations, Notre Dame, and tour bus stops. Variety of restaurants in easy walk, with good breakfast provided in your room. We couldn't recommend this restaurant highly enough for people looking for a great spot from which to explore Paris. The staff were terrific, helping us experience both the best value tourist aspects, as well as getting involved with the 'real' Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in November and really enjoyed it. The ladies in reception very extremely friendly and helpful. I was amazed at their ability to switch quickly from one language to another (ie French to English to German all in the space of a minute). They really care about you and making your stay as enjoyable and comfortable as possible. Our room was one of the larger ones overlooking the courtyard and we thought it was very comfortable and tastefully decorated. Bathroom was modern and clean. We didn't have the breakfast as there were so many cafes nearby. The location is fantastic - although we explored much of the city during our stay we found ourselves coming back here for the brasseries and bistros. Hotel is a bit pricey but so are all Parisian hotels - this is due to the Euro exchange rate more than anything else. Will definitely come back here next time we are in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great stay !”
Reviews.Author: DineSD
Reviews.Content: I came to Paris with my boyfriend to visit my family and some friends had told me about this hotel. I had 5 amazing days : the rooms are very clean and renovated. We had a room on the street side (great view on the church Saint Germain l'Auxerrois) and we've never heard any noise from outside. The staff is very helpfull : They gave us advises for restaurants and it was always very good. When we arrived, they told us to leave our passports ... in the safe in the rooms because of the pick pockets in the metro ... they gave us a map and showed us where we were, the closest metro/bus stations ... My boyfriend wanted flowers to be delivered in the room on our second day (for my birthday) and the staff took care of everything ! They sell fast line tickets for the Louvre museum which is great when you see the line to enter the museum ! They give great advises such as taking the bus instead of the metro, buying both ways tickets directly in Paris when you go to Versailles, where to take the boats for the cruise on the Seine ... The breakfast is served in the rooms whenever you want and it is delicious ! (very good croissants, "pains au chocolat", Retrodor bread, fresh pressed orange juice, organic yogurt). It was like spending 5 days with friends and not just being a client in a hotel. I will definitely go back to this hotel and I will talk about it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: travellinman2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel benefits from a great location right next to the Louvre. The rooms were clean and in very good condition. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful during our stay. Breakfast was also tasty and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NYCgirl1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean, a bit small but not terrible. What I found most frustrating was the staff who were not very helpful at all. If you stay at this hotel do your own trip research and don't expect them to be of much use in that department

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jaedwa1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in November. The location in the city was perfect. The room was tiny, especially the shower, but clean and comfortable...as a matter of fact, that may have been the most comfortable bed I've had in Europe! I must warn folks that this hotel is NOT for night owls. I got back to my room around 3am on the first night and didn't fall asleep until 0430 or so...by 8am, the hotel business was in full swing. Nothing overly obnoxious, but it is such a small hotel, normal activities generate noise...too much for me to sleep through. So I just made sure I was in bed at a decent hour the next ngiht!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tuchka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Relais du Louvre with our extended family and having two connecting rooms was a big bonus. This little hotel is lovely with beautifully french style decorated rooms. The rooms are small indeed, especially the small double ones (its bathrooms are ridiculously tiny). The hotel doesn't have a breakfast room. Having breakfast in a room is an option, but not the most relaxing one taking into account rooms sizes. The staff is friendly and helpful. Hotel's location is its best feature: within walking distance to many major attractions (Siene cruises are 2 minutes away) and opposite to Louvre. My mom had an anniversary during our stay, but the hotel did not go any extra mile to mark it, which I find unfortunate. In general, we liked the hotel and felt very comfortable, but I find it quite overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “painfully small room”
Reviews.Author: jhugon
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Relais du Louvre, and our last one. We love the location of this hotel, on a side street just next to the Louvre. On a previous stay, we had found the room small and quirky, as befits a renovated old building turned hotel, but overall charming. This time, the room we were given, 11, was so painfully small, even by European standards, that we could not open our suitcase, or maneuver around the bed to get dressed. The bathroom was equally small, with a shower so tiny you could barely raise one arm to soap and shampoo. We could not figure out how to work the AC / heat system (which was either not functioning, or this could be our own ignorance), and we were uncomfortable all night. This is really too bad, as we wanted to continue liking this hotel, but even for a "modest" 200 Euros by Paris standards, we had higher expectations for a room to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ML501
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in Suite 51 with our 11 and 9 year old children. The room was a good size with a study area and large bathroom. It was beautifully decorated, clean and quiet. The staff were lovely and a great help in suggesting great restaurants, activities and looking up transport and strike information when required. The location of this hotel is in the heart of Paris, next to the Louvre and a block and a half from Pont Neuf. We walked to this river after dinner a few nights for a view to the Eiffel tower and then around Notre Dame. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, instead found a great bakery about a block and a half along Rue de Rivoli toward the Louvre on the side street which ends in a T intersection. (There is also a small supermarket along this street on the right.) We ate at Angelina's (fantastic morning tea with hot chocolate or a parisian breakfast.) We ate dinner at Au Chien Qui Fume on two evenings- lovely dinner, friendly staff and Divine desserts. The paintings in this restaurant really set the scene. The Paris museum pass was great and let us skip lines at the galleries. Musee De l'Orangerie was very special and go early when the waterlily rooms will be less busy. The gallery under these rooms has a lovely collection, whilst not large, with Renior, Picasso and Monet as well as other artists. Thankyou to Angelique and Sophie and the other staff for our lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Placed & Pleasant Proprietor”
Reviews.Author: Bruce88
Reviews.Content: Sophie was the most pleasant host on our rather short stay. The room was clean and beautifully decorated. Love the elevator! Although right behind the Louvre, and therefore convenient to the important highlights of Paris, we walked all the way from the Bateaux Mouches (Pont d'Alma) one evening - quite a trek. Would recommend to anyone wanting to see the sights of Paris - whatever bank they choose.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: travelin'_mack
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my two grown daughters for a celebratory long weekend in Paris. We had room 32, which accomodates three singles, although two of the beds were pushed together, so it would work for a couple with one child, also. The room was spacious (for a city room), spotlessly clean and well-appointed with a very nice private bathroom. Although there was no view, it meant that we could crack our windows at night and have no street noise. The staff of this hotel is extremely friendly and helpful. One night we couldn't get a cab and were quite late for a dinner reservation. The lady at the desk persistently called for other cabs and then called our restaurant to explain in French why we were held up. This hotel is so close to the Metro stop, the Louvre, and many attractions for tourists, as well as very accessible to cafes and restaurants. We ordered the room service breakfast the last day as we had to leave early for the airport. It was amazingly good and perfect for a day when we were in a hurry. I would stay here again anytime I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel within walking distance of Paris' main attractions”
Reviews.Author: cmb2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not only highly rated by TripAdvisor, but it's also made Karen Brown's list of best hotels in Paris, something few hotels in inner Paris can achieve. Yes, the traditional & superior rooms are small compared to the newer chain hotels, enough room to store everything, but that's all we care about because after all, we're in Paris to sightsee, eat and drink French wine, not spend a lot of time in our room. Even tho it is older, everything has been updated to provide all the amenities one would expect at an excellent 3 star (by American standards) boutique hotel in Paris. The only drawback is the tiny elevator, but since there's not a lot of rooms, there's also not much of a wait if the elevator is occupied when you want to use it. (We found going down the stairs just as quick from our 4th floor.) Beds are very comfortable, baths have marble counters with good showers in the tubs, not a lot of storage for toiletries except for 2 marble shelves on the wall directly behind the toilet. Rooms have restricted views because the hotel is so close to other surrounding structures, but we chose for location: directly across the street from the Louvre, very close to several other museums and Notre Dame, and just a few minutes from the train station for the Eiffel Tower & Versailles (altho we walked to the Eiffel on 1 occasion.) The staff is extremely friendly & helpful, a computer is available in the lobby for guests (you must buy a pre-paid card for minutes at a fairly reasonable rate.) Room service is available but we didn't use it. We found a nice cafe/restaurant around the corner where we had great breakfasts, and we had several great dinners in restaurants in the nearby Place du Dauphine, just a few minutes stroll from the hotel & across a romantic bridge. After we checked out in our rush to get to the airport, the maid found a large bag full of souvenirs & documents from our trip, so we were notified immediately by email. Unfortunately for me, since I didn't check email with my phone, I made arrangements for their safe shipment once I was back home. Sofia & the rest of the staff where on top of it the whole way. In a heartbeat I would recommend this place, not only for its great location, but the price was less than comparable hotels in the same general area. We'd return in a heartbeat for our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “excelent cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Veronica c
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in this hotel and is excellent. The staff is more than friendly, the rooms small but beautifully decorated, excellent breafast!!!!! More that One could expect. Exceptional location

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: AdRock007
Reviews.Content: This little boutique hotel is in the most perfect of locations right across the road to the Louvre and Seine. Metro station on line 1 is on the corner and Chatalet a major hub is 2 minutes walk. The staff are absolutely lovely and the rooms are neat, tidy and although the normal small European style, are extremely comfortable. Will stay here every Paris visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: JWW660
Reviews.Content: It's hard to think of a better location on the right bank than here, and it is amazingly quiet, being set on an alley off the Place de Louvre. The hotel is clean and up-to-date and the staff all speak excellent English (seems like they have a lot of American guests). The rooms are quite small. We had to put one suitcase on the desk, but how much time are you going to spend in your room in Paris? Use some of the money you are saving to have dinner at Le Fumior a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brucebran
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at the hotel in late August. Great location as it is just footsteps from the Louvre and walking distance to many parts of central Paris. We stayed on the top floor â€œpenthouseâ€� apartment. This was one of the only hotels in Paris that could accommodate us without splitting us into 2 separate rooms. The apartment was adequate, and not that large for American standards but probably fine for Parisian standards. We were happy that is was quiet in our apartment (opposed to some other reviewers who said it was noisy). The apartment included a full kitchen, although the refrigerator did not work all the time. Also included a washing machine that was very difficult to run and left our clothes very wet. We were upset that we were told prior to arrival that a dryer was also included but apparently the staff did not understand that an American dryer is a separate machine and not just a spin cycle in a washing machine (which did not fully work all the time). Unfortunately the hotel manager Sophie was on vacation during our stay â€“ I think we would have gotten better service with her there. Putting this aside, I think the hotel was fine and the great location was the most important for us. This is probably why the hotel has such a high ranking on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Sophie was wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: alikeefe
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 12 day trip to France and our last few days were in Paris at the Relais du Louvre.The service we received was above and beyond....I "lost" my passport and Sophie spent over 2 hours helping me fill out all the forms required for a new one as we were leaving the next day.I don't know what I would have done without her! The hotel is quite small which is exactly what I enjoy and perfectly located for seeing all the sites....Perfect! So THANK YOU SOFIE!!! Ali

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: aru90015
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel steps away from the Louvre. The location is perfect. The staff is wonderful. The room, a bit on the small side by American standards, is very comfortable. I will stay here again the next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location”
Reviews.Author: MNDC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of Paris, on a very quiet side-street. I can't imagine a better location. Rooms are tiny, but it's not super-expensive. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosana F
Reviews.Content: The cleanliness of the hotel was always spotless. I stayed at room 35 for 10 days and enjoyed a lot. This room had a front view to a beautiful church (Saint-Germain lÂ´Auxerrois) and a lateral view to the Louvre. You just need to walk around 100 meters to get to the Louvre and a little bit more (220 m) to get to the metro (station Louvre Rivoli). Pont Neuf and Seine River (230 m); Notre Dame Cathedral (1 Km); Zara and Sephora (200 m). The front desk members were always very helpful and friendly (Adeline, Jerome, Frederique and Fatou). IÂ´ll definitely come back again! 8:-)

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Louvre work of art.”
Reviews.Author: andrtsao
Reviews.Content: The Relais du Louvre is located just a few steps from the east entrance to the Louvre on the Rive Droite. Tiny, yet charming, pricey yet welcoming. Given that Paris is always an expensive choice for tourists, the rates are fair, and the location makes it feel worth the cost. Being able to walk quickly to the Seine, Rive Gauche, Tuileries, Louvre, Marais, Les Halles, Notre Dame, etc. is a wonderful thing. The hotel itself is staffed by lovely people. The rooms are snug and well kept, and the air conditioning and wi-fi make it comfortable as well as connected. I have stayed at quite a few three star hotels in Paris, and would recommend it highly.I'll definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with a nice bed”
Reviews.Author: Ttttraveler
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four; our boys are 12 and 14. We love to walk and just experience Paris. We stayed in rooms 14 and 15 as we prefer to be in separate rooms, but they were connected. They were small, but very comfortable. We had a lot of luggage with us due to the length of our trip, but it was no problem in the room. The beds were extremely comfortable. We looked out at the church, which is in front of the hotel. I loved the view of the gargoyles! The location of this hotel could not be better. We walked to the Louvre and the Tuileries. We even walked to the Arc de Triomphe, Les Invalides, and the Luxembourg Gardens. Perfect location for the places we wanted to see. We used the Metro, which was conveniently located, a couple of times. We opted not to have breakfast in the room, so we went around the corner for breakfast at CafÃ© du Pont-Neuf to watch the world go by. The breakfast was certainly reasonable, but nothing special. The hotel was quiet and in a great location. Definitely worth looking into if you are going to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very Lovely Hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: midasttt
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and finding lodging is very difficult without booking 2 rooms. In an extensive search of hotels in Paris, we came across Relais du Louvre. It had everything we needed. An apartment or family suite, a very central location to the sites in Paris, steps away from 2 Metro lines, one of which was a direct line to our train station, and an affordable rate. When we arrived, we were not disappointed. The staff was extremely nice and responsive for all our needs from storing luggage before and after we checked out to directing us to locations we wanted to get to. The room was very spacious and comfortable for the 5 of us. We had our own floor!!! The only negative, which was minor, was that they automatically converted our bill to USD before processing our credit card which resulted in an approximate 3% unfavorable exchange rate. I didn't ask for the bill in Euro, but this was the only place in 2 weeks to convert the rate prior to processing the card. This would not stop us from staying here again and recommending it to our friends that visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: swimmerlosgatos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two 20ish daughters in 2 rooms and went to the Louvre on "free day" - just walked out of the hotel and voila there we were (across the street). Right next to a beautiful eglise and walking distance to La Notre Dame and Musee D'Orsay. Great shopping in walking distance as well. Several good restaurants: Le Fumoir nearby. The staff was great very responsive, rooms very small. Blow dryer very ineffective. Breakfast wonderful. We would stay here again. Slept well - quiet safe hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: florentine65
Reviews.Content: I knew the hotel would be small but that is not a negative. in fact, for its size it is packed with friendliness and charm and is wonderfully clean and fresh despite its traditional appearance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the shadow of the Louvre”
Reviews.Author: centralasiantraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent four nights at the Relais du Louvre at the recommendation of a close friend (and Paris resident). The staff were unfailingly very polite and accommodating. We had expected to have to switch rooms our final night, but were pleasantly surprised upon our arrival to find that we were able to remain in the same room (with a nice view of the Louvre) for our entire stay. The Jr. Suite was spacious (certainly more than we expected!) and comfortable. We'd highly recommend Relais du Louvre to our friends and future visitors to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Erika026
Reviews.Content: We took 2 rooms (a double and a triple) to accommodate my husband, two children 6&9 and au pair 22. The location of the hotel is superb, one block behind the Louvre yet on a quiet street facing a church. The rooms were typicallly-Parisian small but nicely decorated and maintained. Beds and bedding were comfortable, bathrooms adequate (only complaint was ancient hairdryer). The staff throughout our stay was wonderfully helpful and kind, engaging with our children and generously answered our many queries. For our short stay, this was the perfect hotel. It wasn't supremely luxurious but made up it in spades with other attributes.

Reviews.Title: “Sophie was wonderful and made our trip memorable and effortless!”
Reviews.Author: xoxoParis
Reviews.Content: We connected with Sophie who assisted us with our travels plan from home and additionally when we arrived. She understood our tastes in food and provided top notch customer service! We can't say enough about her and didn't find this same level of customer service when we arrived at our next hotel. Sophie booked our train online, found a special price for first class and suggested seats facing forward, These are details that we may have missed and speaks to her level of customer service. At our next hotel they pointed us to a computer that didn't work by either the internet connection or different key board which meant we had to go to the train station and stand in line when time is precious. Our room was nice and became evident that customer service was equally as important. Enjoy your stay and the joys Paris can bring. Sincerely, Mr and Mrs. B.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: FamilyAdventure2011
Reviews.Content: With a 6 yo child, being within walking distance to a lot of major attractions in Paris was wonderful. The rooms are small, but very clean and the staff are well spoken in English and very friendly. To be able to walk around the Louvre after dinner before bed was great and only a short local bus trip to see the Eiffel Tower with lights and Moulin Rouge. Also open top bus for city tour was close by. Highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret . Very Cozy, Relaxing .A Historical Building On A Quiet Street.”
Reviews.Author: Casablanca_11
Reviews.Content: Thank you Sophie,Mgr. and staff for the most pleasant and happy stay in Paris.My wife, Zemfira, is a former history and literature teacher from the Russian Federation and is very particular about location and value for money. She does not care about fancy hotels.She was happy I did my research.This little Boutique hotel offers the best location.across street from Louvre and St. Germain Church and within walking distance to all Monuments, Notre Dame, the famous Pont Neuf Bridge, Latin Quarter, Orsay,RodinMuseums, Seine River 2 blocks away.We stayed 5 nights, ordered pot of coffee each day to get us going.If travelers want there are breakfast cafes to get croissants etc.Sophie and staff helped us with traveling by Metro or Bus and was very knowledgeable about everything concerning Paris and the Paris countryside such as Giverney and Versailles.Will advise our friends from Philadelphia and when we return to Paris with members of our family will stay at Relais Du Louvre.For information to others traveling with children, the hotel has larger rooms. Our room was the right size.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic boutique hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: arranphotographics
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hiotel near the louvre and 5 minutes from notre dame then look no further. The rooms are small but hey you are in the centre of paris and not paying top dollar, after all its paris you want to see not the inside of a hotel room. The staff are welcoming and able to converse in english and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: stefg1007
Reviews.Content: You cant beat the location of the hotel. On a small side street facing the louvre. Its about a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame, the Latin quarter and the Chatlet les Halles train station (train to CDG). The hotel was very clean, and the employees were incredibly friendly. Slept great during our stay. Would definitely recommend and stay again. Check out their website for last minute "crazy fare" prices. We got a double for 113euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “Warmth in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: vanski4
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the apartment with my 3 children and it was a great space, lots of windows, comfortable sofa, table and chairs for dining in the living area, and a separate bedroom with King(or 2 twin) - see the hotel website for photos. It was a bonus to have a small kitchen for breakfast and snacks. Staff is outstanding! They were always warm, friendly and helpful. They always provided great recommendations, directions and suggestions. Location is ideal, truly walk to everything - next to the Louvre, across from Ile de la Cite, metro and bus stops nearby. Only negative to the apartment, is the bathroom set up. Only access is through the bedroom. SInk vanity and tub (no privacy) are part of the bedroom space, with the toilet and small stall shower in a separate enclosed space. It is not a big inconvenience, but the configuration is worth noting. The Relais du Louvre is charming, and I would not hesitate to stay there again when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: woodviewgarden
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the excellent location of this hotel, & although so close to the Louvre, our room facing the church was on a quiet street. Although compact the twin room was immaculately clean & had everything neccessary for a comfortable stay. All the staff were polite & always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: wharthur
Reviews.Content: This is a great value hotel in a great location with friendly staff and comfortable rooms. I'd definitely stay there agian.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Natasha2002
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just got back from a short trip to Paris and this was my first stay at Relais du Louvre. I say first because I plan to stay there again and again. The location is excellent, walking distance to everything including several Metro stops. The rooms are lovely and Sophie and her staff are warm, friendly and very helpful. Further, the rooms are quite reasonable. The 13 euro breakfast was also a treat. What more could one ask?

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, excellent central location and very pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: johnlindbergh
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed here during our trip to Paris. The hotel is a small quiet oasis of calm in the otherwise bustling city of Paris. The rooms are large, well appointed, and very comfortable. The amazing thing is that this hotel is close to everything, but it resides on a quiet street next to an ancient church. Gargoyles seem to stare at you from across the narrow street. The other unexpected pleasant surprise is how quiet the rooms are. Amidst the tumult of the city, this place is a refuge. Certainly, among the most agreeable aspects of the hotel is the Staff. They are incredibly pleasant and helpful, speak excellent English, and will spare no trouble to make your stay more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: gerard211
Reviews.Content: The unbeatable location, friendly welcome, and individual room service of this small Paris hotel were excellent. The room itself was clean and comfortable, with a modern updated bath, but what we appreciated the most after a long day of sightseeing was the very quiet location on a side street between the Louvre and Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “A warmth place in the heart of paris”
Reviews.Author: LitoGreece
Reviews.Content: As commented in some of the reviews I've read before visiting, some of the rooms are small (singles, doubles). But this cannot be an obstacle when compared to the friendly personnel, the cozy environment and the location. I will definitely stay here again; however, I'll make sure to ask for a room at the front side of the building, as back rooms have limited day light (If I had to stay in a single room facing back, I would probably feel depressed, due to the small size of the room and the lack of natural light).

Reviews.Title: “The best location and accommodations for families”
Reviews.Author: TERACINGUSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Relais du Louvre in May 2010. The apartment provided wonderful and spacious accommodations for our family (2 adults and 2 college-age children). We felt as if we lived in the city rather than just visiting. Sightseeing and resturants were very convinient and the staff were always helpful, providing us with both directions and recommendations for dining and cultural activities. The Relais's proximity to the Ile du Citie was especially useful for us. We look forward to returning often.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jancv
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Relais du Louvre and after having been absolutely wowed on our first visit by friendliness, helpfulness of staff, location and price, I have to say we were a little disappointed. Some of this could possibly be attributed to the fact that we stayed on a weekend and the lovely Sophie was not in attendance. Staff, although responding to "Where can I find...." type requests, did make us feel as if we were intruding on their time. The room left a little to be desired as far as cleanliness was concerned. On picking something up from the bathroom floor, I also picked up quite a few hairs none of which were my colour or length. However I have to say that the first stay we had at the Relais was outstanding and maybe this was just a little glitch which I am sure sometimes happens. The location cannot be beaten. You are able to walk just about anywhere and if you can't walk, there is a metro station just around the corner. Breakfast is quite expensive for what it is. There is much better value and quality to be had in the nearby cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: xbcrat
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with decent size rooms and bath, central location and a top notch staff. Madame Sophie, the manager, could not have been more hospitable and caring about her guests. Can highly recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, hospitable, enchanting, boutique hotel behind the Louvre”
Reviews.Author: judie18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I cannot say enough positve, wonderful things about our 3 1/2 day stay at this enchanting, well managed, quintessential Parisian boutique hotel. The rooms are very feesh, comfortable and nicely appointed. Lovely updated bathrooms. This GEM sits across the street from the Louvre in a very nice neighborhood with wonderful restaurantst and cafes. It sits only one block from the Seine, Metro (RER), Saint Germain, Rive Gauche and Notre Dame. ten minutes to Tuileries and 10 minutes more to the Chant de Elysee and the Arc. We walked everywhere from here! The manager and staff are extemely nice, pleasant very helpful for dinning and touring suggestions.and metro info etc. they couldn't do enought o make your stay pleasant. They have a 24 hr desk attendant so getting in late is just fine! They will deliver a very Parisan breakfast , cafe, tea, croissants, jams, yogurts etc) to your room every morning at your schedule! The fee per night is very reasonable for the quality of our stay here. very very very nice. I would hightly recommend the Hotel Relais De Louvre to any colleagues or family traveling to Paris! If we ever have the opportunity to travel to Paris again there is no decision as to where I will stay! It will be at ths hotel!! I loved it

Reviews.Title: “Three star hotel with a five starr staff”
Reviews.Author: boblNashvilleTn_
Reviews.Content: Le Relais du Louvre is rated a three star property by the French tourist board, which is accurate. The rooms are nice, and ours was quite large for a Paris room. The location is unbeatable, but put that all aside. The staff is deserves five stars. This was our first stop on a two week stay in France, and there was nothing that this staff wouldn't do to make our stay perfect. They arranged transportation from the airport, to the train station, got our bags to the room, drew maps so we could get anywhere we wanted, and generally improved our time management so we could make the most out of our visit. Even a guest that had a medical problem and didn't check out of the room our friends were supposed to have didn;t throw them. They checked our friends into a next door hotel, took care of their bags to that room, and the next day moved them and their bags into a room at their hotel. We would stay here anytime we come to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Loved LeRelais du Louvre, Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: europeanjourneys
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the apartment. Was one of our favorite hotels on our trip. Great service, clean, excellent location, great price and value! Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: dmrj
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay when exploring Paris. It is directly across from The Louvre and within walking distance of many other sites, plus the very convenient transit system. The hotel is clean and comfortable. Our room was on the first floor and opened up to a private courtyard. The staff is exceptional - friendly, personable, and so very helpful. I would stay there again, with no hesitation. We took advantage of the ride they arranged for us from the airport - very helpful after a long flight and much jet lag. We did not order the hotel breakfast - so many cafes in the area to choose from!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Relais du Louvre”
Reviews.Author: KazzaLou
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Relais du Louvre and would recommend it. We wanted to stay in a larger room/suite to give us more space. The hotel has an apartment which is lovely, spacious and light with a large sitting area plus also two spacious suites. This hotel is in a fantastic location close to the Louvre and the staff who run it were extremely helpful and friendly to us whilst we were there and during the booking process. Breakfast is delivered to your room at a time of your request. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem with views of the Louvre!”
Reviews.Author: JimboLenham
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is located across from the Louvre and next to the church of St Germain-l' Auxerrois. To say that it's a real treat is an understatement. The staff could not be more attentive! The only slight inconvenience is that there is no breakfast room, so you either breakfast in your room or at a nearby cafe, of which there are several. Final word - most of their clients are repeat visitors. JimboLenham

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous location, nice staff and a good nights sleep.”
Reviews.Author: jackytabacky
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location, just beside the Louvre. And also it is very quiet so you can retreat after the hustle and bustle of the streets of Paris. Not sure about the rest of the rooms but mine was fairly compact and the shower was beyond belief (between the controls/taps sticking out and the door not closing properly in an already tiny space, it sure was hard to manouvre. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast is only served in the rooms and it is good value but without the space in the room it is probably nicer to eat out in one of the local cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: GRM59
Reviews.Content: This cozy little hotel really is right across the street from the Louvre. I was so surprised it really was that close, and we could enter the Louvre from that entrance. After our day at the Louvre, we strolled along the Seine to return to the hotel. The staff was friendly, and there were street cafes nearby. We stayed two nights and had a peaceful sleep, even though the rooms are small. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly little hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: drewsusan
Reviews.Content: The Relais du Louvre is a petite, attractive, and well-situated hotel located across a narrow street from the beautiful Eglise Saint Germain l'Auxerrois and less than a city block from east end of the Louvre. It is just a few steps from the Seine, the Pont Neuf, Ste. Chapelle, and Notre Dame. The hotel is stylishly, conservatively decorated, with comfortable and attractive furnishings. Our room, a junior suite (#51), was capacious, spotless, and well-lighted. The staff were very professional, friendly, and extremely helpful. Breakfast was served in the room at a time specified by us, and included, upon request, extras (such as eggs/omelets) beyond the usual continental breakfast items, which were plentiful, including fresh-squeezed orange juice and excellent croissants, yogurt, jams, butter, etc. The Relais du Louvre offers much at a reasonable price, and deserves serious consideration by those who want a very French atmosphere, charming service, and an outstanding location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: TravelLovrs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Relais du Louvre for 4 nights. The rooms were small, by US standards, but pleasant and comfortable. When we opened our curtains, we looked out on a huge Gothic church, complete with gargoyles. Besides a comfortable bed, we had a small bathroom, a table, a small safe, a refrigerator, and ambiance! This hotel is right across the street from the Louvre, a 15-minute walk to Notre Dame. The Seine is right around the corner. It is also two blocks from two different Metro stations, and a 5 minute walk from a grocery store, pharmacy, shops and restaurants. Perhaps the best thing is the superior staff. They were friendly, helpful, and always willing to help with suggestions, travel advice, and figuring out the vagaries of Metro and bus systems. They spoke excellent English and, I'm sure, other languages as well. This hotel does offer breakfast in your room as there is not enough room for a breakfast area. It was pricey so we opted for buying fresh croissants to go at the nearby shops. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, value for money, great position”
Reviews.Author: LynnBDenHaag
Reviews.Content: I find it difficult to believe the review from Rob (Heuston)and am sorry he had a bad experience. I am super fussy when it comes to cleanliness and I could not fault the room (35). Veronique at reception was most helpful and accommodating. We had a lovely stay. It is a "pet friendly" hotel, so don't be surprised to see dogs in the lobby. The Hotel is so close to everything. Even close to a "hop on hop off" bus stop. (The red bus). All in all a wonderful stay. Lynn (Netherlands)

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: VIVALASVEGAS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Le Relais du Louve mainly because of the great reviews here on TA. Very happy to say they were spot on. Location was my number one priority and this place is idea. Literally just yards from the Louvre and the River Seine. The are is safe and quiet with lots of places to eat round and about. The Metro station is just up the street and getting to anywhere in Paris is pretty easy from here. The 3 staff members i came into contact with were all nice and very helpful. I had a single room which was small yes, but it was fine for my purposes and was very clean, as well as having AC and a Safe, which a lot of hotels don't have. Value wise it was ok and you will pay a lot more for a hotel with this location. Overall a wonderful experience and i would stay here again for certain, if i'm ever in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAFScarsdale
Reviews.Content: Le Relais du Louvres is a small friendly hotel perfectly located across the street from the Louvre and a short walk to our favorite part of Paris, the Latin Quarter. The staff was warm and helpful and answered all of my (many) questions over the internet prior to our visit. I took my two daughters (ages 30 and 16). We had two adjoining rooms which worked very well and together cost what a single room might cost in a more "Americanized" commercial chain hotel. The hotel is on a quiet street overlooking a beautiful church, with views of the Louvre.The area is safe with many nice cafes right nearby and some cute shops on the nearby Rue de Rivoli. Also, the hotel rooms have individual air conditioning units, which we needed as we were there during a heat wave.

Reviews.Title: “Louvre's backdoor Secret Resting spot”
Reviews.Author: Esly
Reviews.Content: Walk out the back door of the Louvre and cross the street to the right of the old church there and you have a small beautiful little hotel whose location made a sightseeing trip in Paris fantastic. Just around the corner from the Seine and a block from the bridge that crosses the tip end of the island in the river into the Latin quarter. AAAAaaaahhh was my thought! When my feet were too tired to continue on in the Louvre I could retreat for a rest and then continue on without more than a short walk, no taxis, no subway! Nearby are several small restaurants and convenient stores located on the street beside the river. I had a single bed small room just big enough for what I needed. The room was beautiful clean with a soft comfortable bed, air conditioning that I controlled and a minibar. I had wi-fi access with a password they gave me. The first floor single room has no window except the door that opens onto a small courtyard that is shared with another room. The people at the desk spoke English and were very kind and helpful when I had questions. Breakfast could be ordered and brought to your room.

Reviews.Title: “great location, comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Di_08
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel mainly because of the location and price, you can see the Louvre from your hotel window. The rooms are small- but this is Paris, and I would not expect anything else. The twin room had room to put both suitcases on the floor and still move around, the bathroom was small but funtional and clean. Breakfast was good, only tried it once as there are plenty cafes within 5 mins of the hotel. Metro is within 2 min walk. Just a great location, restuurant "Le Fumoir" is about 100m across the street and is highly recommended either for a glass of wine with olives or dinner

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Pooferone
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in Room 52 - 5th floor overlooking the church across the street and the back side of the Louvre. The room was spacious and neat/clean. We heard zero street noise at night during our stay. Multiple metro stations within 2 blocks. An easy walk to to Notre Dame. Breakfast was extra - croissants, juice, coffe and hot chocolate - but not a bad value considering the convenience of having it served in your room. The staff is fantastic. So helpful in all respects - arranging taxis, dinner reservations, recommendations. We would definitely stay again. It makes one wonder why some would pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous small hotel. Unbeatable location.”
Reviews.Author: deathbycupcake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lovely Relais du Louvre for 5 nights on our recent spring break trip to Europe. We were given room 52, which is a triple on the fifth floor with a nice view of the adjoining church and the Louvre. We arrived mid-afternoon and were greeted by a very nice and professional young man who told us in great detail all about the hotel's services. We rode the teeny tiny elevator up to our room and were pleasantly surprised by the room's cleanliness and spaciousness. The room had one king sized bed and one twin. The bathroom was very nice and equipped with a towel warmer and a bidet. The bathtub was very large and it was nice to enjoy a warm bath at the end of the day. The toilet was in a separate room, which was nice. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but it does offer room service. We ordered breakfast for three the first morning. It arrived promptly at 9 a.m., as requested. Each breakfast consisted of two croissants, a chocolate pastry, and a small loaf of french bread. One breakfast was plenty for the three of us! The coffee and hot chocolate were delicious. They also send small jars of jam, honey, and some cheese. Everything was fantastic and it was a great way to start the day. The location is really great. Three metro stops nearby, the Louvre, Notre Dame, Champs Elysses, just to name a few places, all in walking distance. There was quite a bit of street noise at night, so bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. I never heard any noise from other rooms. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Very efficient and professional. They were happy to suggest cafes or recommend sites to see. They took care of all our transportation arrangements. I can't imagine that one could find a nicer hotel for the price anywhere in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Us”
Reviews.Author: ChrisnAnneSydney
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal, situated in a quiet steet close to the Louvre with easy walking access to the Left Bank and the restaurants & shops within Chatelet as well as Paris attractions. The hotel was clean and charming with extremely friendly and helpful staff, all spoke English. Due to changed travel plans we had to return to Paris and did so assured that the hotel management would provide accommodation or arrange alternative accommodation close by. We can certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not trust this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mazzini
Reviews.Content: Do not trust in the reservation system of this hotel and also in their staff. I booked a room ( confirmed by e-mail and also through phone call and personally), I gave my credit card number as warranty and when I arrived in the hotel there was no room avaible for me. They sent me to another hotel in a very bad area in Paris. Be careful, the same can happen to you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKathy
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at the Relais du Louvre. It was an excellent choice! The location is great. The staff are excellent. The rooms charming and very clean. We had a superior room which is a good size, our friends had a standard room which is a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “a delightful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: extenter
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at this hotel as an overnight stop. We really liked it. The room was small but had everything in it that we needed, i.e. a comfortable bed, mini bar, tv. telephone, an arm-chair, a desk up a couple of steps and en suite facilities. Breakfast was served in the room, a very pleasant continental breakfast. The staff who ordered it for us apologised because they could not give us a buffet breakfast as we were leaving very early in the morning on a Sunday. Nevertheless they produced this breakfast exactly on time. The coffee was lovely, the orange juice was fresh as were the croissant served with butter and jam. The ensuite facilitiy again was small but beautifully clean, nice towels and lovely hot water. In addition we had a menu for a small but again adequate dinner which the staff collected from the cafe nearby and served in our room. Our room had a door out to an enclosed court yard shared with another room also on the ground floor. We slept with one of the windows open as the room was well heated, so that there was a little noise at first from the other room but this soon died down We were particularly happy in this little hotel and would always go again for an overnight stop. One point - we took a taxi from the Gare du Nord and the taxi driver had no idea where we were to go, so we think it vital to have the full address to hand.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: JnJ_7
Reviews.Content: The Relais de Louvre is 1 block from the Louvre and 1 block from the Seine. You really can't beat the location. All of Paris is within an easy walk or Metro ride. The staff is friendly and English-speaking. Our room was small, but clean and quite adequate. As of July '08, rooms started at 115 euro, which is quite reasonable for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for family”
Reviews.Author: TravelwithBoys5
Reviews.Content: We just returned from four nights at the Le Relais du Louvre. We booked two rooms - a triple for our children and a double for my husband and myself. Although they offer a room service breakfast we felt 13 euro per person was too high for breakfast in the room (we would have been sitting on the bed to eat since there wasn't a table for three anyway!). The hotel staff was very helpful and kind. We arrived with laundry from the first part of our trip and although it was too much for them to handle they offered to deliver it for us to a laundry and they also picked it up for us and delivered to the room - could not have asked for more. The biggest negative for the hotel is the noise - it seemed that every sound from every room carried. Our children stayed in the same room location as us but two floors up and we could hear them laughing at times. They were not being overly rowdy - just the sound carried everywhere. If you are a very light sleeper and this bothers you it may not be the place to stay. Otherwise it was great. Fantastic location - walking distance to metro (Louvre-Rivoli just one block away), sites (Louvre, Notre Dame, Pompidou Center, Musee D'Orsay all well within walking distance), and food. I felt the price we paid was very fair for this location. Yes - I would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming in every way!”
Reviews.Author: jsnco
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris - I took my three teenagers (ages 19, 17, 14) and we were thrilled with this hotel! Location? Perfect - the Louvre was right across the street and we were just a short walk to the bus station which took us all over Paris. We stayed in the apartment on the top floor of the hotel and it was perfect for us - complete with a fully equipped kitchen. The breakfast that was delivered in the morning was scrumptious - coffee, tea, hot chocolate, juice croissants, pastries, jam and cheese - YUM. On the mornings we did not have breakfast delivered, we just stopped for a quick bite at the little cafe on the corner - so convenient. Everyone we came across in the lobby was so helpful : ). They helped to make our first trip to Paris perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Charm and Location!”
Reviews.Author: tavkomet
Reviews.Content: This is a charming little hotel in a spectacular location. The tiny lobby is staffed by the friendliest people who speak perfect English. Our room, a triple, was adequate in size and charm. The bathroom was functional, not spectacular. We were only in Paris for two days and so we maximized our visit by going non-stop. Due to the excellent location we were able to walk to Notre Dame, Sainte Chapelle, the Louvre which is just across the street and to our tour with Paris Vision (not a good experience) and at the end of our tour we walked from the Eiffel Tower back to the hotel, walking down the Champs Elysees. It really is an ideal setting. it was nice to have breakfast delivered to our room and the croissants and bread were lovely, but like all other French hotel breakfasts ridiculously overpriced (13 Euro per person). We were so tired after a full day of sight seeing and walking that we came back to the hotel not wanting to go far for dinner. and the helpful gentlemen working the desk tried to get us a reservation in a nearby restaurant. He had no luck, but suggested a delivery to the hotel which worked out perfectly for us. We were so grateful! The restaurant that was recommended for lunch by the hotel manager wasn't very good - but we won't hold that against them. We should have been more discerning. All in all, this was a nice spot that we would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Should Have a Much Higher Rating.”
Reviews.Author: Holger
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this small hotel in 2006 and loved everything about it. We booked a suite, actually a very large well fitted room with lots of light and very comfortable beds. Returned in 2007 for ten days to celebrate a major birthday and found everything just as well run. The staff is absolutely great and very helpful. The manager Sophie goes out of her way to be of assistance and the rest of the staff clearly take their cues from her. We had the same room and they recalled that I like extra towels and hangers. I had made many special requests for restaurants and other activities and everything I asked for was set and ready when we arrived. This small hotel should really receive a much higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: Philly Viking
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned for the second summer in a row to this marvellous hotel located just behind the Louvre. We had the same suite on the fifth floor and enjoyed the new mattresses, the ample seating places (three chairs, a desk, a sofa and a bench at the foot of the bed. There is also lots of closet space, a well-equipped bathroom, toilet and bidet, and the room is bright and sunny. It faces the courtyard and eliminates most of the noise from the busy area. The manager, Sophie, and the staff are efficient and go out of their way to be helpful in dealing with directions, making reservations, and even providing one of the hotel's parking spaces for our rental car. We plan to return as often as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Paris for families”
Reviews.Author: Plan4it
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at Relais du Louvre a couple of weeks ago. We were in the top floor suite which has the feel of a small apartment with its kitchen area small fam room and bedroom. Also a small balcony but only for one person really. The location is perfect for Louvre goers and close enough to Champs Elysees, etc. It is not a luxurious suite but is definitely clean, spacious and comfortable enough for fam of 2 adults with 11 and 13 year old and a reasonable deal for that location in Paris in lieu of 2 rooms. Breakfast brought to room was a nice touch and satisfactory. There is also underground parking across the street (ask for the access card) which is a benefit in Paris. The two women we encountered were also very friendly and helpful. There was a man on the "night shift" that was no help at all when asked for a close by restaurant suggestion and for decaf coffee. He was too busy on his cell phone both instances.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: Gblyn
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Paris in 12 months. I chose this hotel because of the location (different from our first visit) and I thought I would go up in price to get something nicer than our first visit. We had a triple room, which was much roomier than our first visit at the Tim Hotel Tour Eiffel (still not huge but we did have room to move around when our luggage was on the floor - not so at Tim Hotel). Decor was nice. We did have a problem with the shower head being broken, which we advised to reception, but being over the weekend, nothing seems to happen whilst casual staff are on - a little disappointing (higher price doesn't always mean better - bathroom in Tim Hotel was comparable and in working order). They state that the toilet is separate and it is but you still have to go into the bathroom to get to the toilet. Staff were helpful and friendly (as was in Tim Hotel), lift very small (same as TH), rooms were non smoking and fresh (TH room was supposed to be, but we were told guests disobey - this was probably our main gripe with TH). The location was reasonably close to Metro and Hop on Bus stop, lovely atmosphere on Pont de Arts on Saturday evening - just steps away. There is no breakfast room - which didn't really bother us, as there are cafes nearby. We were leaving Paris via Eurostar, and this hotel is within a reasonable taxi ride to Gare Nord. All in all, apart from the shower we were happy with our room and the location, but I still question whether the extra money (Triple - 203 euro, May 07 - 117 euro at the Tim Hotel May 06 - and our Aussie dollar makes that difference even greater) was worth the minimal advantages. I wouldn't say don't stay here, but I think I would try somewhere different again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, but no sound-proofing”
Reviews.Author: asdfjkl
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for its location between the Louvre and the Notre Dame. It's also very handy for two metro stations. We knew the rooms would be small from other reviews, so were prepared for that. The landing on each floor is only slightly bigger than the lift (which is supposed to fit 4 adults but is a squeeze even with children), so the rooms are very close to the lift. Anyone who is particularly sensitive to noise should avoid this hotel at all costs. As the previous reviewer noted, sound-proofing is minimal. You could hear someone cough in another room (I don't know whether it was upstairs or downstairs). Furthermore, the (interconnecting) rooms facing the so-called courtyard (a postage stamp of a paved area, with the back walls of other buildings rising on every side of it - not a pleasant view!) are subject to any conversations or sounds from the occupants of the ground-floor room which opens on to this patio (guests beware!) - every word of conversation carries up the air well clearly, as well as cigarette smoke! So, while the staff were friendly and efficient and the location was terrific, I would not stay at this hotel again. It was certainly very much overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Very Small”
Reviews.Author: jazzyepi
Reviews.Content: This is a very small hotel in a great location- right next to an old church, the shopping on Rue de Rivolis, a block from the Louvre etc. It feels recently renovated, with a modern bathroom. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The issue was the size of the room, really a small box. The bed is more than half of the space. Soundproofing from other rooms is minimal. Breakfast is not included in the price but you can walk out of the hotel and have a great meal.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JRFLORIDA
Reviews.Content: We vacationed in September. Me and my 2 adult children. The reception was very friendy and accommodating. The room - a triple - was suprisingly spacious with an L - shape allowing some privacy. Our room looked at the courtyard, very quiet. The bathroom was super clean. The elavator was tiny, but to be expected in an historial building. Right smack next to the Louvre, the metro,a 400 years old church and the Seine. Great location. Priced reasonable. Housekeeping was friendly and non intrusive. Safe in room. Highy recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Paris”
Reviews.Author: taxmon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Relais du Louvre from September 16 to 23. This little gem is certainly the best kept secret in Paris. First, the location could not be better: on the right bank but very close to the left bank (just one bridge away). The Louvre is litterally next door, the Avenue de l'Opera and the Marais are within walking distance, the Champs Elysees are just 4 metro stations away and Notre Dame is just a few blocks away. The Ritz or the George V can't beat that! Secondly, the staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable and very accomodating. Thirdly, the rooms, although on the small size for the smaller ones, are very comfortable and cosy. Finally, the price could not be better. Don't tell your friends or your relatives. This has to remain a secret. Otherwise the hotel will be fully booked next time I try to book a room at the Relais du Louvre. Merci Sophie, Marie and Company.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but....”
Reviews.Author: girasol01
Reviews.Content: This small, pretty hotel is in an excellent location for getting around with relative ease to all the major sites. Loved being able to just cross the street to get to the Louvre, also just around the corner from the Seine. I stayed here in April 2005 for four days on a budget trip, and given the hotel's location, I was able to walk almost everywhere. However, the hotel is located on a street that at night is quite secluded and desolate. And, except for the coffee shops facing the Seine that close at 9PM, there is a scarcity of restaurants in the immediate vicinity. Yes, the patisserie at the corner was wonderful, quite lovely, it was my favorite place for breakfast. But dinner options are limited. One night I got back from sightseeing at 9PM, wanting to eat quickly, and feeling too tired to wander far in search of a restaurant. It was very annoying to find that everything in the area had already closed at that hour. The only options within a few blocks were a smoker's bar, and an actually rather nice Chinese restaurant. The other problem I encountered had to do with the hotel management. I'd booked a double room months in advance, but upon arrival was shown to a tiny single room whose bed was basically just a couple of mattresses thrown on the floor. The staff tried to argue that this is what I had reserved but fortunately I'd brought with me copies of my reservation confirmation, so they were forced to acknowledge their error. Even so, my actual (also very small but much more reasonable and comfortable double) room had already been given away and since the hotel was full, I had no choice but to stay one night in the smaller "room" until I could be moved the following day. If I hadn't been so exhausted after a long flight from NYC, I would've changed hotels at that point. My experience of Paris itself more than made up for these inconveniences, but next time I'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our 2 daughters for 2 nights, small but just how long do you want to stay in your room in PARIS? Clean, lots of hot water. Another plus was the least expensive parking rates in Europe so far (Brussels and Amsterdam), a short walk to the Louvre, slightly longer to Notre Dame and "the inside-out museum", an ambitious walk to the Eiffel Tower. Small French elevator, and a holding place for wheelchair in lobby. Staff very friendly, eager to please. Hotel has wi-fi, but it is a pay by hour deal, bring your own wire for your laptop and internet is free. Bit of history Paris's House of Representatives record's were printed on this site in 1800's, and the lobby used to be a CafÃ© Momus where Voltaire and Victor Hugo hung out plus a scene from La Boheme is set there! Cool. Favorite view was one of St-Germain-l'Auxerrois' gargoyles that is making a rude face and flying buttresses seen from the 4th floor connected rooms. We will return in spring!

Reviews.Title: “Hate this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in December. First, the room was so small. There was about a foot on each side of the bed and a tiny table with a small TV at the end of the bed, and a bathroom, which was dirty! And the street that you overlook is really the backside of the next building - not something you'd want to look at! I am a single woman who travels alone and this hotel is in the back of a narrow, dark quiet street that I was followed down by strange men on several occasions while walking back to the room at night. My third night I was so frightened I came back to the room in tears and told the staff I would be checking out in the a.m. and flying back home, cutting my trip short by 8 days! They gave me the local number for AA, gave me a copy of my bill and sent me away. Fortunately, the AA rep convinced me to try another hotel, which I did (Hotel Moliere, much better location, slightly less expensive, MUCH larger room with 2 balconies and nice staff!). After checking me out and having me sign my 'final' bill, this hotel put another charge on my card without my signature for a cancellation fee that they could not bother to tell me about to my face. When I went back to speak to someone, they were so rude I was literally speechless. Long story short, with sooo many hotels in Paris this would be the last one I'd ever recommend. My stay was awful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in this cozy and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodJane
Reviews.Content: I was wary of what my friend and I would find at Relais du Louvre, given the inexpensive rate for a single room. We were delighted! We each had a single room on the courtyard. Yes, the room is small and the bathroom is very small, but no matter. Each room had ample wadrobe space, TV, mini-bar, writing desk, thick towels, quiet central AC. The hotel is very well kept, nothing shabby around the edges. Pleasant decor and very clean. I had read every review I could find before arriving in Paris - it is true that the entrance to the shower in the signle room is very small - a heavy person would have problems! And the metro does run under the hotel, but did not bother me - and I am very easily bothered by noise. I had coffee each morning in my room - it arrived a minute after I placed the call to reception. We had breakfast at the wonderful boulangerie just down the street. The hotel staff were extremely helpful. Excellent location. We felt very much at home after our 6 day stay. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY happy with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Relais du Louvre May 7 - 13 and were VERY happy with our stay. We were in a triple room and it was much larger than we expected. PROS: The staff was EXTREMELY friendly and spoke excellent english. They made reservations at a show and at restaurants for us, which was awesome since we spoke very little french. The room was very clean and and spacious. There was a computer in the lobby with internet access (7 Euros per 1/2 hour). Fantastic location!! 5 minute walk to the Louvre, 5 minute walk to the Metro. Bakery and cafe on the same street as the hotel and many shops and restaurants within 5 - 10 minute walk. Nice mini-bar in the room too. CONS: The shower water was sometimes cold (I assume at times when other guests were also showering). And sometimes we could hear other guests in their rooms talking, watching TV, using the blow dryer.... Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and service”
Reviews.Author: Mari58
Reviews.Content: When arriving to this hotel I felt a little disappointed, we had a room with three beds and this room type doesn't have view to the Louvre. It is not a cheap hotel, however, once there, I realized that it has everything that one expects of a deluxe hotel: Air conditioning, safe, TV, telephone, shower, hair dryer, the bathrooms are wide and the toilet is separated from the rest, the beds are narrow but very comfortable. There is a terminal for internet in the lobby (with the use of a prepaid card). But finally one doesn't go to Paris to be see the hotel, and the best of this hotel is itÂ´s excellent location, a block from the Seine, a block from the Louvre, and itÂ´s very near two subway lines. The staff is qualified to help the tourists. Since I travel alone with two children in the summer, staying at this hotel we had the possibility to be in the fair of Tuileries at night and return walking to hotel. I recommend this hotel for the perfect service that it offers and itÂ´s excelent location, although it doesnÂ´t look very pretty, it has everything, I will always come back to the Relais du Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Relais and Paris are great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Relais du Louvre one year ago while travelling with 3 friends. We were given a suite at the top of the hotel which was beautiful (and quirky - you couldn't open the bathroom door and the toilet door at the same time). That said, the room was nice and clean, the front desk was very accomodating, and I thought the breakfast in room was a nice touch. As far as location, this hotel is close to everything. One word of caution, they do lock the fron door early in the evening so if you're out enjoying the night life you may need to knock for a while to get back in.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Close to everything. Wonderful boulangerie around the corner and a couple of cafes as well. Other restaurants were not a very far walk. 2 Metro stops very close. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The room was a typical European room. Not extravagant, but very clean. I would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Le Relais du Louvre
HotelInfo.Address: 19 rue des Pretres-Saint-Germain-l'Auxerrois, 75001 Paris, France
